name: Senator Todd Young
tweet_text: Today, on the 75th anniversary of VJ Day, we salute them all, and remember with gratitude the victory they earned and the freedoms they defended.

name: Senator Todd Young
tweet_text: From the Atlantic to the Pacific, our soldiers, sailors and airmen risked all for the cause of human liberty. And across the state and nation, industries and individuals alike did their part as well.

name: Senator Todd Young
tweet_text: The August 15, 1945 special addition of the Indianapolis Star declared ‚ÄúPEACE!‚Äù That peace had been won by the heroism of America‚Äôs military and the strength of its citizens.

name: Senator Todd Young
tweet_text: Sacrifices were made at home too, where household goods, food, and gasoline were all rationed. Hoosiers communities endured these shortages and eagerly collected rubber, tin, paper and other materials to aid the war effort.

name: Senator Todd Young
tweet_text: The celebration was well-deserved for soldier and citizen alike. Four trying years had passed since America joined the fight to defeat totalitarianism. Over 400,000 of its citizens died for that cause ‚Äì nearly 12,000 of them Hoosiers.

name: Senator Todd Young
tweet_text: In Indianapolis, men and women in uniform filed up Meridian Street, while thousands of citizens packed Monument Circle, some even wading into the fountains of the Soldiers and Sailors Monument. Nearby giant Vs ‚Äì for victory ‚Äì emblazed the front of L.S. Ayers and Company.

name: Senator Todd Young
tweet_text: WWII concluded 75 years ago today with the surrender of Japan. Like other Americans, when Hoosiers heard the news they formed parades & marched up their streets. They gathered in their town‚Äôs centers to celebrate & cry. They draped bunting & hung flags from businesses and homes.
